TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICspAsymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Defines methods that allow an class to enumerate key container information, and import and export Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI)–compatible key blobs.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Classes that extend the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm> class should implement the ICspAsymmetricAlgorithm interface to enumerate key container information using a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CspKeyContainerInfo> object, and to import and export Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI)–compatible key blobs.

Docs.summary: Gets a object that describes additional information about a cryptographic key pair.
Docs.value: A object that describes additional information about a cryptographic key pair.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CspKeyContainerInfo> object specifies whether the key is exportable, and provides the key container name, information about the provider, and other information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] ExportCspBlob(bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: to include the private key; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Exports a blob that contains the key information associated with an object.
Docs.returns: A byte array that contains the key information associated with an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ExportCspBlob method returns a blob that contains key information that is compatible with the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImportCspBlob(unsigned int8[] rawData) cil managed

Docs.param: A byte array that represents an asymmetric key blob.
Docs.summary: Imports a blob that represents asymmetric key information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ImportCspBlob method initializes the key data of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm> object using a blob that is compatible with the unmanaged Microsoft Cryptographic API (CAPI).
